0.title: Detailed inquiry into Morbi bridge collapse is need of hour: PM Modi
0.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said a detailed and extensive inquiry to identify all aspects relating to the Morbi bridge collapse is the need of the hour. He chaired a high-level meeting to review the situation. PM Modi added that key learnings from the inquiry must be implemented at the earliest.

1.title: 4 mn vehicles renewed PUC papers in last 10 months in Delhi: Report
1.article_body: The owners of about 4 million vehicles in Delhi renewed their Pollution Under Control (PUC) documents in the last 10 months, according to the Transport Department's data. The development came as the Delhi government on October 12 announced that vehicles without PUC papers would be barred from refuelling in the Capital. The government rescinded the order on October 25.

2.title: I don't think B'wood is facing any negativity, my films did well: Anupam
2.article_body: Veteran actor Anupam Kher said in an interview that Bollywood is not facing any negativity, adding that two of his films have emerged as blockbusters this year. "I say it proudly, 'The Kashmir Files' did ₹350 crore, 'Karthikeya 2' did ₹130 crore. I'm riding on ₹480 crore right now," he said, adding, "If it's a good film, it'll do well."

3.title: 9 rescued, dozens missing after migrant boat sinks off Greek island
3.article_body: A search and rescue operation was launched on Tuesday for dozens of migrants after their boat capsized and drowned off the coast of a Greek island near the capital Athens. The Greek Coast Guard said nine survivors, all men, had been found on an uninhabited islet. According to the rescued men, nearly 68 people were on board the ill-fated vessel.

4.title: Pic of B'luru auto carrying toffees, books for commuters goes viral
4.article_body: A picture of an autorickshaw carrying sanitisers and snacks like biscuits and toffees for passengers in Bengaluru has gone viral on Twitter. The picture showed that driver Rajesh also keeps devotional books, water bottles and bandages in his vehicle. A netizen said, "Even the cabs of Ola, Uber [and] Meru...don't have anything like this considering that they charge much more!"

5.title: Accident victim's sister to get free education: Bangalore University
5.article_body: Bangalore University (BU) has decided to provide free education to the younger sister of Shilpashree, the 23-year-old postgraduate student who died in a road accident inside the campus last month. The victim's family, however, said the university had promised a government job. Some of the university staff have also decided to donate one day's salary to the victim's family.

6.title: PM respected abroad because of India’s deep-rooted democracy: Gehlot
6.article_body: Congress leader and Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday said PM Narendra Modi gets respect globally because of India's deep-rooted democracy. "[PM Modi] gets the respect because he is the Prime Minister of the country of Gandhi, where the roots of democracy run deep and where, even after more than 70 years of independence, democracy is alive," CM Gehlot said.

7.title: L&T fined ₹5 lakh, ordered to stop work at BJP office in Delhi: Report
7.article_body: Delhi government has reportedly issued a notice to stop construction work at a BJP office in Delhi. Further, the government has fined construction agency Larsen & Toubro (L&T) ₹5 lakh for violating construction ban in Delhi. Taking to Twitter, Delhi Minister Gopal Rai said, "Huge irregularities found at BJP's under construction office site during surprise inspection under 'Anti Dust Campaign'."

8.title: Bengal won't be left out of CAA implementation process: BJP's Suvendu
8.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari on Tuesday claimed the process of CAA implementation has started in the country and West Bengal won't be left out. "The Matua community members and other backward castes like Namasudras will get...benefits soon," Adhikari said. His comment comes after the Centre decided to grant Indian citizenship to minorities mostly from Pakistan, who have migrated to India.

9.title: Johnson & Johnson to buy Abiomed for $16.6 billion
9.article_body: Johnson & Johnson (J&J) said it will buy cardiovascular technology company Abiomed for $16.6 billion to strengthen its medical device segment. Abiomed, which develops technology to treat coronary artery disease and heart failure, will run as a standalone business within J&J once the deal is completed. J&J will pay for the acquisition with a combination of cash and short-term financing.

10.title: I have been forced to come out as bisexual: 18-year-old actor Kit Connor
10.article_body: Actor Kit Connor, who plays a bisexual character in the show 'Heartstopper', tweeted, "I'm [bisexual]. Congrats for forcing an 18-year-old to out himself. I think some of you missed the point of the show." It's being speculated this was in response to allegations of queerbaiting. The allegations surfaced after Connor was spotted holding hands with his female co-star Maia Reficco.

11.title: How does T20 World Cup 2022 Group 1 points table read with 1 match each left?
11.article_body: New Zealand, England and Australia are the top three teams with five points each on Group 1 points table in T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage. New Zealand are on top with a superior net run-rate. Sri Lanka are placed fourth with four points, followed by Ireland. Afghanistan have been eliminated from the semifinals race.

12.title: Women students whipped by Taliban officer while protesting burqa policy, video out
12.article_body: A video has shown female students in Afghanistan getting assaulted after they protested a ban on their entry to a university for not wearing a burqa. The incident reportedly took place outside the gates of Badakhshan University on Sunday. A member of the Taliban's vice and virtue force was seen chasing after students with a whip.

13.title: AAP protest in Bengaluru after city potholes claim two more lives
13.article_body: The AAP staged a protest at Bengaluru's Freedom Park following the death of two youths due to potholes in the city. "It is a state-sponsored massacre. The shameless government...is committing crimes by killing innocent lives," said AAP. The party claimed that the state government delays releasing funds for road repairs if contractors do not agree to pay a commission.

14.title: Rapper Takeoff shot dead at 28 reportedly 'over a game of dice' in US
14.article_body: American rapper Takeoff, who was best known as a member of the hip-hop trio 'Migos', was shot dead at the age of 28 outside a club in Houston, US. Takeoff, whose real name is Kirshnik Khari Ball, was shot dead by a person after a fight reportedly broke out during a dice game. He was pronounced dead on the scene.

15.title: Uber may restrict auto services in some parts of Bengaluru: Official
15.article_body: Ride-hailing platform Uber on Tuesday said it's considering restricting auto-rickshaw services in some parts of Bengaluru. Uber India Head of Central Operations Nitish Bhushan said Uber won't be able to operate within the current 10% commission cap rules in Bengaluru as per Karnataka High Court's temporary orders. "We want to work with the government on appropriate fare regulations," Uber stated.

16.title: DMK leader, who called actresses in Tamil Nadu BJP 'items', booked
16.article_body: DMK leader Saidai Sadiq has been booked for allegedly making derogatory remarks against actresses-turned-BJP leaders in Tamil Nadu. He had called BJP leaders Gayathri Raguramm, Namitha and Gautami "items" and mocked Kushboo Sundar. Sadiq had also said that unlike the DMK, BJP depended on the "actresses" to make inroads into Tamil Nadu.

17.title: Twitter Co-founder Dorsey retains 2.4% indirect stake in company
17.article_body: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey retained a 2.4% indirect stake in the company under the new ownership of Elon Musk, according to a US Securities and Exchange Commission filing. The value of Dorsey's over 18 million shares is nearly $1 billion, the filing revealed. Notably, Musk will serve as Twitter CEO after he completed the $44-billion acquisition on Thursday.

18.title: UP govt to give ₹17,500 'encouragement allowance' to youths for start-up
18.article_body: Uttar Pradesh government is planning to provide a monthly 'encouragement allowance' of ₹17,500 to the youths for a year for setting up businesses. As per the policy, financial assistance of ₹5 lakh would be given to the start-up for making a new product and another grant of ₹7.5 lakh would be given for its launch in the market.

19.title: Delhi HC upholds life sentence of stalker who killed DU student Radhika
19.article_body: The Delhi High Court has upheld the life sentence awarded to the man who murdered Delhi University (DU) student Radhika Tanwar in 2011. Dismissing Vijay Saini's appeal against the conviction, the court said, "[His guilt]...has been proved beyond reasonable doubt." Vijay allegedly stalked Radhika and when she rejected his advances, he shot her with a pistol in a premeditated act.

20.title: How can Punjab's pollution reach Delhi? Minister on Delhi's air pollution
20.article_body: Punjab Agriculture Minister Kuldeep Singh Dhaliwal on Tuesday said Punjab's stubble is not the cause of pollution in Delhi. "Rohtak, Panipat and Sonepat are the ones contributing to Delhi's pollution. How can Punjab's pollution reach Delhi? How can Amritsar's, and not Panipat's smoke, reach Delhi?" he said. "Centre is the only one responsible for this mess," Dhaliwal added.

21.title: Srinagar-Leh highway closed after rainfall, light snowfall in J&K
21.article_body: The Srinagar-Leh highway was closed for traffic after Jammu and Kashmir experienced rainfall and light snowfall, officials said on Tuesday. "The weather is cloudy and snowfall is going on at...few places particularly in Zojila and Sonamarg higher reaches," Mukhtar Ahmad, Deputy Director of IMD, said. In a tweet, traffic department said that Srinagar-Jammu highway and Mughal Road were open.

22.title: It was wake-up call: Madan Lal on India's loss vs South Africa in T20 WC
22.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Madan Lal said the loss against South Africa in ongoing T20 World Cup was a wake-up call for Team India. "Because we didn't perform as we would've liked...I'd like to commend the bowlers because, at one stage, we thought that we could win the match," he added. South Africa chased the 134-run target with two balls to spare.

23.title: WhatsApp bans over 26 lakh Indian accounts in September
23.article_body: WhatsApp on Saturday said that it banned over 26 lakh Indian accounts in September 2022. According to WhatsApp's monthly report, the Meta-owned platform received 666 grievance reports from India, of which 496 reports pertained to a 'ban appeal'. The rest of the reports were under categories such as support and safety, the platform added in its report.

24.title: Max Healthcare's net profit rises 216.18% YoY to ₹457 cr in Q2
24.article_body: Max Healthcare Institute on Tuesday reported a 216.18% rise in its consolidated net profit to ₹457.35 crore in the July-September quarter, as against ₹144.65 crore in the year-ago period. The healthcare provider's revenue from operations stood at ₹1,137.12 crore during the quarter, up from ₹1,019.26 crore. The company reported that total expenses increased to ₹897.72 crore.

25.title: Wannabe PM Rahul should first convince his people to elect him as MP: KTR
25.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao (popularly known as KTR) commented on Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's remarks about TRS' plans to convert into a national party. "International leader Rahul Gandhi who can't even win his own parliament seat in Amethi ridicules Telangana CM KCR's national party ambitions...Wannabe PM should first convince his people to elect him as an MP," KTR said.

26.title: India uses e-rupee to settle ₹2.75 billion of government bonds
26.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India's central bank-backed digital rupee was used to settle secondary market transactions in Indian government bonds worth ₹2.75 billion as part of a pilot. Data showed that trades in a total of three securities – five-year 7.38% 2027 former benchmark 6.54% 2032 and the current benchmark 7.26% 2032 bonds – were settled under the new route.

27.title: 21, including 19 minors, drown during Chhath Puja rituals across Bihar
27.article_body: At least 21 people, including 19 minors, have drowned in separate incidents during Chhath Puja celebrations across Bihar since Sunday. Two boys aged 9 and 13 drowned while cleaning the ghat and a 10-year-old boy drowned while offering 'arghya' in Patna district. Three children from same family also drowned while bathing in Purnea. Many have been reported missing across Bihar.

28.title: Leopard dies after being hit by vehicle on B'luru-Mysuru Expressway
28.article_body: A leopard aged about three years died after allegedly being hit by an unidentified vehicle on the Bengaluru-Mysuru Expressway on Monday morning. The incident took place in Ramanagara district, 50 km from Bengaluru. Forest officials said the speeding vehicle might have hit the animal on its head. A police officer said there are no speed breakers on the expressway.

29.title: Tech Mahindra reports 4% fall in net profit in Q2 at ₹1,285 crore
29.article_body: Tech Mahindra released its results for the Q2 of 2022-23, reporting a 4% fall in consolidated post tax profit to ₹1,285 crore. The company had reported a net profit of ₹1,339 crore in the year-ago period. The company's overall revenue increased to ₹13,129 crore from ₹10,881 crore in the same period last year, registering a 20.7% growth.

30.title: 'Diwale Dulhania...' to re-release in select theatres on SRK's b'day
30.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan's 1995 film 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge' will re-release on November 2 to mark the actor's 57th birthday. As per Yash Raj Films' Instagram post, the film will release in PVR, INOX and Cinepolis theatres across India. 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge', directed by Aditya Chopra, also featured Kajol and late actor Amrish Puri.

31.title: Temple chariot collapses in K'taka; video shows devotees running to safety
31.article_body: A chariot fell down due to a broken wheel while it was being carried by devotees during 'Rathotsava' at Sri Veerabhadreshwara Temple in Karnataka's Chamarajanagar. No injury has been reported so far. In a video that has surfaced on social media, devotees are seen running to safety as soon as the chariot collapsed.

32.title: Decomposed body of man travels nearly 900 km in toilet of Jansewa Express
32.article_body: The decomposed body of an unidentified man was recovered from a toilet in Jansewa Express at Uttar Pradesh's Roza Railway Station. The body travelled at least 900 km undetected from Bihar's Banmankhi station. The GRP personnel broke open the toilet door after passengers complained of a foul smell emanating from inside. No ID card was found on him, police said.

33.title: IAEA begins probe of Russian claim about Kyiv making 'dirty bombs'
33.article_body: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) on Monday said it had started inspection of two Ukrainian nuclear sites where Russia claims Kyiv is manufacturing "dirty bombs" for use in the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict. The inspections had been requested by Kyiv in the wake of the accusations. Both sites being investigated "have been visited regularly by IAEA inspectors", the agency said.

34.title: Monkey roams around in Delhi Metro station, clears security check
34.article_body: A video of a monkey roaming around in a Delhi Metro station has gone viral on social media. In the video, the monkey can be seen casually walking and making its way to clear the security check at Nawada station of Blue Line Metro. Reacting to the video, an Instagram user wrote, "Token toh lele [Take the token]."

35.title: FirstMeridian Business Services gets SEBI's approval for ₹800 crore IPO
35.article_body: SEBI has given its approval to staffing firm FirstMeridian Business Services to raise up to ₹800 crore through an initial public offering (IPO). The IPO will include a fresh issue of equity shares worth up to ₹50 crore and an Offer for Sale (OFS) worth up to ₹750 crore by promoters and existing shareholders.

36.title: Why is NASA preparing to shine a 'flashlight' on the Moon's surface?
36.article_body: NASA has said its 'Lunar Flashlight' (a small satellite the size of a briefcase) is ready to launch in November. The satellite will use lasers "to search for water ice inside the darkest craters at the Moon's South Pole", NASA said. The satellite, that'll be launched on a SpaceX rocket, will take three months to reach its science orbit.

37.title: AIMIM aligned with BJP, its 'only job' is to cut votes of Cong: Jairam
37.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Tuesday criticised the AIMIM, saying the party is aligned with the BJP and its "only job" is to fight polls to cut votes of the Congress. "There's no doubt that they take oxygen from the BJP and AIMIM gives booster dose to the BJP," Ramesh said. His comment comes as 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' reached Hyderabad.

38.title: Building a product to disrupt LinkedIn, to make resumes irrelevant: Unacademy CEO
38.article_body: Unacademy Group's Founder and CEO Gaurav Munjal on Tuesday said that the edtech startup's R&D team is working on a product that wants to disrupt LinkedIn. He asked Twitter users for suggestions on naming the new product and he also suggested four names - 'ProjectX', 'nextlevel', 'Unprofile' and 'Jobkey'. In another tweet, he said, "We want to make resumes irrelevant."

39.title: Ban on loud music post 10 pm only in Jubilee Hills pubs in Hyd: HC
39.article_body: The Telangana High Court has lifted restrictions on playing loud music in Hyderabad pubs after 10 pm with the exception of those in the neighbourhood of Jubilee Hills. In September, a single judge bench of the HC had banned all pubs from playing loud music after 10 pm and ordered adherence to permissible noise levels.

40.title: Online gaming unicorn Games24x7 launches ₹400 cr fund for startups
40.article_body: Online gaming unicorn Games24x7 launched a ₹400 crore fund to invest in interactive entertainment startups. The fund will be used over the next five years and Chief Financial Officer Rahul Tewari said the money will come from its own balance sheet. Founded by Bhavin Pandya and Trivikraman Thampy, Games24x7 raised $75 million earlier this year at a $2.5 billion valuation.

41.title: Police seize drugs worth ₹85 lakh in Mumbai's Wadala, 1 arrested
41.article_body: The Mumbai Police on Monday seized drugs worth ₹85 lakh from Wadala and arrested one person, 28-year-old Zahid Tipu Sultan Khan, in the case. According to police, at around 11 pm, they spotted a man on a bike and checking led to the recovery of around 16.18 kg of charas. Police have registered a case under sections of NDPS Act.

42.title: Massive asteroid that could pose threat to Earth found hiding in Sun's glare
42.article_body: Astronomers discovered three near-Earth asteroids hiding in Sun's glare. One of them is the largest "potentially hazardous" object spotted in last eight years, according to NOIRLab. "Our...survey is scouring...area within...orbits of Earth...We've found two large near-Earth asteroids that are about 1 km across, a size...we call planet killers," said an astronomer on two of the three asteroids.

43.title: Our son put Riteish and me on the road to veganism: Genelia
43.article_body: On the occasion of World Vegan Day, actor-couple Genelia Deshmukh and Riteish Deshmukh spoke about turning vegan. Genelia credited their son for putting her and Riteish "on the road to veganism". "He...told me, 'Aai, you love Flash (our dog) and you eat chicken...Both are animals. What's the difference?' That put me on...road to understanding what I was doing," she said.

44.title: Dog owner beats security guard with stick in Gurugram; video viral
44.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media, showing a dog owner allegedly beating a security guard with a stick on Saturday in Gurugram. The incident took place when the man, who is reportedly a society member, was stopped by the guard from walking his dog in a part of the society. The guard suffered severe injuries in the incident.

45.title: Was duped by a staff member, I trusted her way too much: Urfi
45.article_body: 'Bigg Boss OTT' fame Urfi Javed in a recent interview revealed that she was duped by a staff member, leading to her losing several lakhs of money. "It was my fault...I trusted her way too much," she added. Urfi further said she doesn't intend to file any complaints against the former staff member, as "she was once dear" to her.

46.title: Over 75 planes of Indian carriers grounded due to technical issues: CAPA
46.article_body: Global aviation consultancy firm CAPA said on Tuesday that more than 75 planes of Indian carriers are currently grounded due to maintenance and engine-related issues. The planes, accounting for around 10-12% of Indian fleet, will have a significant impact on financials in the second half, CAPA said. CAPA added that non-supply issues are also expected to emerge next year.

47.title: Sun Pharma Q2 profit rises 10.5% YoY to ₹2,262 cr, revenue up 14%
47.article_body: Sun Pharmaceutical Industries on Tuesday reported a 10.5% year-over-year increase in its consolidated net profit to ₹2,262 crore in the July-September quarter. The company saw a nearly 14% rise in its total revenue from operations at ₹10,952 crore from ₹9,626 crore in the year ago quarter. Shares of the pharma major closed at ₹1,033 on BSE.

48.title: PM Modi meets those injured in Morbi bridge collapse at civil hospital
48.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday visited Morbi civil hospital where over 100 people injured in the suspension bridge collapse are admitted. At least 135 people were killed in the incident. Pictures showed PM Modi enquiring about a patient's health at the hospital. The hospital was painted overnight for PM Modi's visit.

49.title: Fintech startup Decentro raises $4.7 million in Series A round
49.article_body: Decentro, a Y Combinator-backed startup that helps firms enter the fintech market, has secured $4.7 million in Series A funding round. The round was led by Singapore and US-based Rapyd Ventures, US-based Uncorrelated Ventures and Leonis VC from Europe. Angel investors, including CRED Founder Kunal Shah, Groww CEO Lalit Keshre and Gupshup CEO Beerud Sheth also participated in the round.

50.title: Shubman Gill smashes highest score by an Indian in a T20 knockout match
50.article_body: Punjab opener Shubman Gill on Tuesday smashed his first-ever hundred in T20 cricket. The 23-year-old reached the three-figure mark off 49 deliveries and went on to score 126(55) against Karnataka in quarter-final match of Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy (SMAT) 2022. Shubman's 126 is also the highest score by an Indian in a T20 knockout match.

51.title: Shubman Gill smashes his first-ever hundred in T20 cricket
51.article_body: Punjab opener Shubman Gill on Tuesday smashed his first-ever hundred in T20 cricket. The 23-year-old reached the three-figure mark off 49 deliveries and went on to score 126(55) against Karnataka in quarter-final match of Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy (SMAT) 2022. Shubman's 126 is also the highest score by an Indian in a T20 knockout match.

52.title: Twitter bans over 54,000 accounts in India for sexual, terror content
52.article_body: Twitter has banned 52,141 accounts in India for promoting child sexual exploitation and non-consensual nudity between August 26 and September 25. Twitter, now owned by Elon Musk, removed 1,982 accounts for promoting terrorism. In a monthly report, Twitter said it received 157 complaints from users in India in the same time-frame, out of which action was taken on 129 URLs.

53.title: Pune-based DPSU disposes of 258 tonnes of scrap, makes ₹1.48 crore
53.article_body: Pune-based Defence Public Sector Undertaking Munitions India Limited (MIL) has disposed of 258 tonnes of scrap from its various units. It's earned ₹1.48 crore from the scrap disposal, Indian Express quoted officials as saying. Moreover, 600 tonnes of scrap has been identified that will be disposed of soon. Notably, this was done as part of government's Special Campaign 2.0 initiative.

54.title: Man dies after being pushed off building by robbers in Thane
54.article_body: A 26-year-old vegetable vendor died after he was pushed off a five-storey building by three unidentified men who allegedly robbed him of ₹12,000 in Mumbra, Thane. The incident happened when the deceased, Sujit Rajaram Gupta, had come to the building to collect empty vegetable crates, police said. A case has been registered under IPC sections 302 and 397.

55.title: England hand NZ their first defeat in T20 World Cup 2022, go 2nd on points table
55.article_body: England defeated New Zealand by 20 runs in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 Group 1 match on Tuesday. With this, New Zealand suffered their first defeat in the ongoing tournament. New Zealand, England and Australia have accumulated five points each. New Zealand are on top of the table with superior net run-rate (NRR), while England are now second.

56.title: Income Tax Dept raids Cartier, Rolex retailer Kapoor Watch Company: Report
56.article_body: The Income Tax Department is conducting searches at Kapoor Watch Company, the Indian retailer of Audemars Piguet, Bvlgari, Cartier, Omega and Tag Heuer brands, as per a report. Sources said that around 20 premises were covered in this search which started on Monday morning. All the showrooms and premises of its promotors were covered in this search, the report added.

57.title: New pic of SRK & Deepika Padukone from 'Pathaan' sets leaks online
57.article_body: A new picture of Shah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone has leaked from the sets of their upcoming film 'Pathaan', which is going viral on social media platforms. Reportedly, the makers are planning to release the teaser of 'Pathaan' on November 2 to mark Shah Rukh's 57th birthday. The film, directed by Siddharth Anand, will release on January 25, 2023.

58.title: Finnish PM urges Hungary, Turkey to swiftly approve Finland, Sweden's NATO bids
58.article_body: Finland's Prime Minister Sanna Marin has urged Hungary and Turkey to swiftly approve Finland and Sweden's applications for NATO membership. The two Nordic countries asked to join NATO in May in response to Russian invasion of Ukraine but faced objections from Turkey, which accused the nations of giving shelter to groups it considers as terrorists.

59.title: Kartik Aaryan, Kiara Advani's pics from 'Satyaprem...' shoot get leaked
59.article_body: Leaked pics of Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani from their shoot for 'Satyaprem Ki Katha' have surfaced. Both of them are currently shooting in Ahmedabad. In one of the leaked pictures, Kiara can be seen sitting behind Kartik on a scooter. After 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', this will be the second time when Kiara and Kartik will be working together.

60.title: I appeal to innovators to develop techniques to conserve water: Prez Murmu
60.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu stressed on water conservation and appealed to scientists, town planners and innovators to try to develop techniques that will help conserve water resources. "There will be a need to effectively conserve water to meet the demands of our future generation and technology will play an important role in it," said the President.

61.title: Adani Ports Q2 profit rises by 69% to ₹1,677.48 cr, revenue up by 33%
61.article_body: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone (Adani Ports) reported a 68.5% year-on-year surge in September quarter profit to ₹1,677.48 crore. Consolidated revenue from operations grew by 32.8% to ₹5,210.80 crore as cargo volume increased by 15% year-on-year to 86.6 million metric tonnes. The revenue from port and SEZ activities rose to ₹4,609.29 crore.

62.title: PM Modi visits site of Morbi bridge collapse that killed 135 people
62.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday visited the site of the Morbi bridge collapse which killed at least 135 people and injured around 100 others. Videos and photos from the site showed PM surveying the rescue work and meeting people carrying out the relief operations. He emphasised ensuring that all possible assistance was reaching the affected persons, PMO said.

63.title: 24-yr-old youth arrested for looting 60 sacks of onions in Prayagraj
63.article_body: A 24-year-old youth was arrested for allegedly looting around 60 sacks of onions, along with his two accomplices, from two persons who were carrying the consignment from Prayagraj’s Jasra mandi to Pratapgarh on October 30. The youth, who was staying in Holland Hall hostel illegally, along with his accomplices purportedly held the victims captive for hours in the hostel.

64.title: Tata Motors' total sales rise by 15.5% to 78,335 units in October
64.article_body: Tata Motors said it registered a total sale of 78,335 units in October, witnessing a growth of 15.49%. The company had sold a total of 67,829 units in the same month last year. Tata said total domestic sales were at 76,537 units as against 65,151 units in the year-ago month, an increase of 17%.

65.title: Boss hits junior with clock for failing to meet monthly sales target in Mumbai
65.article_body: A 35-year-old man reportedly hit his junior with table clock after he failed to meet his monthly target of selling health insurance plans in Mumbai. Anand Singh resigned after missing the target and asked the accused, Amit Singh, for incentives, which he denied. When Anand demanded to discuss the matter before other employees, Amit lost his cool and hit him.

66.title: Macau tests 7 lakh residents after detecting 11 COVID-19 cases
66.article_body: Macau, the world's biggest gambling hub, carried out mass testing of its 7,00,000 residents on Tuesday after detecting 11 cases of COVID-19 in the past few days. Authorities had locked down a major casino in the city on Sunday, ordering staff and guests to stay inside until November 1. More than 1,500 people are reportedly sealed inside the casino.

67.title: Aus survivor of Halloween stampede in Seoul blames govt for mismanagement
67.article_body: Nathan Taverniti, 24-year-old Australian who survived stampede that killed over 150 people in Seoul, blamed officials for failing to employ crowd control measures despite anticipating massive turnout during Halloween festivities, The Associated Press reported. Taverniti said there should have been enough police on standby. "This incident is a result of government's mismanagement," Taverniti said.

68.title: Jos Buttler breaks record for smashing most runs for England in T20I cricket history
68.article_body: England white-ball captain Jos Buttler on Tuesday broke the record for scoring most runs for England in T20I cricket history. With his 73(47) against New Zealand in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Tuesday, Buttler took his tally of runs in T20I cricket to 2,468. He overtook the previous record of 2,458 runs held by ex-England captain Eoin Morgan.

69.title: 22-yr-old Hyd woman who 'jumped' from 5th floor in UAE is alive: Embassy
69.article_body: A 22-year-old Hyderabadi woman who was assumed to be dead after falling from the fifth floor of a building in the UAE is currently undergoing treatment at a hospital, the Indian Embassy in Dubai said. Majlis Bachao Tehreek leader Amjed Ullah Khan said Afsha Begum, who worked as a housemaid in Ajman, had attempted suicide by jumping from the building.

70.title: After 'Chief Twit', Musk changes Twitter bio to 'Twitter Complaint Hotline Operator'
70.article_body:
Elon Musk on Tuesday changed his bio from 'Chief Twit' to 'Twitter Complaint Hotline Operator' and changed his profile picture to a photo of his younger self that is holding a telephone. Musk has been engaging with several Twitter users after reports alleged that the social media company 
may charge its users around $20 for the blue tick verification badge.

71.title: What if I couldn't go to Harvard?: Co-founder as boAt becomes Harvard case study
71.article_body: Electronics maker boAt's Co-founder Aman Gupta on Tuesday took to Instagram to share the news that Harvard Business School has written a case study on boAt. "Harvard Nahee Jaa sake to Kya hua...apna kaam aur apnee company pahucha dee (What if I couldn't go to Harvard? I sent my company and work to Harvard)," he wrote.

72.title: Sh*t version of my film: Kolkata filmmaker on T-Series' 'Mister Mummy'
72.article_body: Kolkata filmmaker Akash Chatterjee has demanded T-Series to credit him for Riteish Deshmukh's film, titled 'Mister Mummy'. In a Facebook post, Akash Chatterjee alleged that T-Series "stole" the script of his film and came up with their "sh*t version" of it. He also shared that his story and concept are registered with Screenwriters Association, Mumbai.

73.title: MMRDA launches 2nd of longest steel decks on Mumbai Trans Harbour Link
73.article_body: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) launched the second of the longest (180 metre) orthotropic steel decks on the Mumbai Trans Harbour Link, a sea link that will connect South Mumbai to Navi Mumbai. The first 180-metre-long steel deck was launched in March 2022. These steel decks weigh as heavy as six large-sized aircraft.

74.title: UPL's Q2 net profit rises by 28% to ₹814 crore, revenue up by 18%
74.article_body: Global crop protection products manufacturer UPL posted a 28.4% year-on-year rise in consolidated net profit at ₹814 crore as against ₹633 crore in the corresponding quarter last fiscal. The company's consolidated revenue from operations surged by 18% year-on-year to ₹12,506 crore. UPL's stock fell by 2.14% on the NSE after the results and it closed 1.63% lower at ₹718.30 apiece.

75.title: 50-yr-old woman suffers stroke after nerve gets pressed during hair wash at Hyd salon
75.article_body: A 50-year-old woman suffered a 'beauty parlour stroke' after getting a hair wash at a salon in Hyderabad. Doctors treating her said that a key vessel supplying blood to the brain was pressed when she bent back her neck for the wash. The term 'beauty parlour stroke syndrome' was coined after it was first reported in 1993 in US.

76.title: BJP's ideology favours rising air pollution: Delhi minister Gopal Rai
76.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai criticised the BJP and said that its ideology favours rising air pollution levels as the party voiced support for the bursting of firecrackers. "Punjab would have seen a large-scale reduction in stubble burning had the Centre supported the state government's initiative to provide a cash incentive to farmers for not burning crop residue," he said.

77.title: Survey of 62,000 hawkers & vendors starts in Pune district
77.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has started a biometric survey of 62,000 hawkers and vendors in the region. Government norms make it mandatory for all civic bodies to survey hawkers every five years. The agency that will conduct the survey will get ₹60 for surveying each hawker.

78.title: 730 crore UPI transactions worth over ₹12 lakh crore conducted in Oct
78.article_body: About 730 crore transactions worth ₹12.11 lakh crore were conducted through Unified Payments Interface (UPI) platform in October, NPCI data showed. This is a 7.7% increase in transaction volume as compared to September's 678 crore transactions. Meanwhile, the number of instant interbank fund transfers through IMPS in October stood at 48.25 crore and the value was at ₹4.66 lakh crore.

79.title: 14 people, including 3 kids, injured in Chicago drive-by shooting
79.article_body: At least 14 people, including three children, were injured in a drive-by shooting on Monday night in the Garfield Park neighbourhood of US' Chicago, police said. The youngest victim was a three-year-old, Chicago Police chief informed. A preliminary probe indicated the involvement of at least two shooters, he added. No suspects have been identified yet, police said late on Monday.

80.title: We haven't purchased Russian oil directly: Sri Lanka Energy Minister
80.article_body: Sri Lankan Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera has said his country had been buying Russian oil through trading companies in Dubai and Singapore, but not directly from Russia. "We have requested the Russian government for assistance for energy security for Sri Lanka. We have had positive responses but so far no direct supplies," Wijesekera added.

81.title: 1 killed in Russian missile attack in Mykolaiv, apartment building demolished
81.article_body: Russia fired four missiles into Mykolaiv, in southern Ukraine, killing one person and demolishing an apartment building. This comes a day after Russia launched missile attacks on several cities including the capital Kyiv. Russian President Vladimir Putin said that the strikes and decision to suspend grain deal were in response to Ukraine's drone attack on Moscow's fleet in Crimea.

82.title: Video shows dog running with human head in its mouth in Mexico, police pull it out
82.article_body: A dog was filmed in Zacatecas, Mexico, running down the street with a human head hanging out of its mouth. The head and other body parts were abandoned in an automatic teller booth with a message referring to a drug cartel, an official told Fox News. Police were eventually able to pull the head out of the dog's mouth.

83.title: Hyderabad Pride March to be held on November 13 after gap of 3 years
83.article_body: Hyderabad city's Pride March, known as 'Hyderabad Queer Swabhimana Yatra', will be held after a gap of three years on November 13. The city first witnessed the rainbow parade in 2013. Over a thousand individuals are expected to attend the event. The organiser said the event has no rules on attire.

84.title: There wasn't much pressure on him: Afridi on Kohli's dropped catch vs SA
84.article_body: Reacting to Virat Kohli dropping Aiden Markram's catch in India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against South Africa, Shahid Afridi said, "I don't think there was much pressure on Kohli during that catch." "[Teams] seem to be focussing more on their batting and bowling but fielding wins you 70% of games," added Afridi. South Africa defeated India by five wickets.

85.title: Result of massive corruption: Kejriwal on Morbi bridge collapse
85.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said the Morbi bridge collapse in Gujarat was a result of massive corruption and prayed for those who lost their lives in the incident. "Why was a watchmaking company which had no experience of bridge construction allowed to do so?" Kejriwal questioned. He demanded the resignation of Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel after the incident.

86.title: AAP contesting Gujarat polls to help BJP: Jairam Ramesh
86.article_body: Congress General Secretary Jairam Ramesh alleged that Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) is contesting elections in Gujarat to help BJP. AAP entered the fray to cut into Congress votes, he further said. "The way AAP leaders are campaigning and raising issues, we see no difference between BJP and AAP. The two parties are engaged in shadowboxing," he said.

87.title: Mumbai Fire Brigade receives 4 ISO certifications for performance & service
87.article_body: The Mumbai Fire Brigade (MFB) has received four certifications from the International Organisation for Standardisation (ISO) for its performance and service, becoming India's first and only such authority to acquire them. The MFB has received certifications in four different parameters. "The brigade's performance will be recorded as per...international standards," Chief Fire Officer of MFB said.

88.title: MTNL and BSNL aim to raise $2.34 billion: Report
88.article_body: MTNL and BSNL are reportedly planning to raise an aggregate of ₹193.56 billion ($2.34 billion) through government-guaranteed bonds. MTNL plans to raise ₹109.10 billion in November. The telecom company is looking to issue bonds maturing in 10 years and will pay a semi-annual coupon. MTNL will meet bankers and investors on Tuesday, according to the report.

89.title: Stubble burning cases in H'yana not even 10% of Punjab's: CM Khattar
89.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar said that the cases of stubble burning in Haryana are not even 10% of that in Punjab. "Last year, there were 2,561 incidents of stubble burning whereas it decreased to 1,925 this year. While 13,873 incidents have taken place in Punjab this year," Khattar added while addressing a press conference in Chandigarh.

90.title: Over 3,000 law students get incorrect marksheets, MU says 'technical glitch'
90.article_body: Over 3,000 law students who graduated from Mumbai University have received their final year marksheets with the wrong Permanent Roll Number (PRN), jeopardising their future plans. "I applied for an LLM course at another college. During the marksheet verification process, I was told my PRN was invalid," said a student. The university claimed that the error was a "technical glitch".

91.title: Kerala airport halts flights for 5 hrs for 'God's passage' through runway
91.article_body: Thiruvananthapuram International Airport closed its runway and halted flight operations for five hours from 4 pm to 9 pm on Tuesday to enable the smooth passage of the procession of Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple. The airport has been halting flight operations twice every year for decades for the bi-annual ceremonial procession that passes through the runway.

92.title: 18 persons cheated of ₹10,000 each on the pretext of job offers in Noida
92.article_body: As many as 18 persons have been cheated of at least ₹10,000 each on the pretext of getting jobs at a mobile company in Noida, police said. On Sunday, the victims submitted a complaint at the Sector 20 police station against the suspects, police added. "We have also inquired about the said company in Surajpur," police further said.

93.title: Doing a biopic on Sonia Gandhi would be interesting: Mahima Chaudhry
93.article_body: Actress Mahima Chaudhry, who will soon feature in Kangana Ranaut's directorial 'Emergency', has said that doing a biopic on former Congress President Sonia Gandhi would be interesting. "Her journey notably from Italy to India, and then becoming a political figure," Mahima further stated. The 'Pardes' actress will play the role of writer and activist Pupul Jayakar in 'Emergency'.

94.title: Tesla may begin mass production of Cybertruck by 2023 end: Report
94.article_body: Tesla is reportedly aiming to begin mass production of its pick-up truck, Cybertruck, by the end of 2023. The Cybertruck was unveiled in 2019 by Elon Musk, and last month Tesla said that it would be readying its Austin, Texas plant for its early production. In January, Musk pushed the launch of Cybertruck to 2023, citing shortages in sourcing components.

95.title: Cong to take out yatras in states not covered by Rahul's march: Jairam
95.article_body: The Congress party is organising Bharat Jodo Yatras in states not covered by the main walkathon led by party leader Rahul Gandhi, Congress' Jairam Ramesh said on Tuesday. He announced this during the Bharat Jodo Yatra which entered Hyderabad today. "In the next few days yatras will also be undertaken in Bihar and Jharkhand," Jairam said.

96.title: Chhattisgarh CM inaugurates tribal dance fest, shares pics & videos
96.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel inaugurated the third edition of the National Tribal Dance Festival in Raipur today. The state CM's Office also shared pictures and videos of the festival on Twitter, some of which were of artists parading to the tune of the song 'Sare Jahan Se Achha Hindustan Hamara'. This comes as the state celebrates its foundation day today.

97.title: Tata to add 45,000 women workers at iPhone plant in Tamil Nadu: Report
97.article_body: Tata Group is reportedly planning to hire 45,000 women workers at its electronics factory, that makes iPhone components in Tamil Nadu's Hosur, in 18 to 24 months. Tata Group is reportedly in talks with Wistron to build an electronics manufacturing joint venture, seeking to assemble iPhones in India. Tata had established the plant with an investment of ₹5,000 crore.

98.title: Pics show personal belongings of people crushed to death in S Korea stampede
98.article_body: Pictures of the personal belongings of those who were crushed to death during the Halloween stampede in South Korea's Seoul have been released. The items include shoes, jackets and items of clothing as well as masks, belts and toys. Around 150 people, most in their teens and twenties, died in the stampede recently.

99.title: Actor Prateik Babbar gets blue belt in Brazilian jiu-jitsu
99.article_body: Prateik Babbar recently won a blue belt in Brazilian jiu-jitsu. The actor, who has been training for about four years, said, "If there's...lull period in my life, MMA gives me balance...I think it's fuel for my soul. This is something I want to do for...rest of my life." Prateik added his ultimate goal is to become a black belt holder.

100.title: Pak's batting is always a problem, it's never solid enough: De Villiers
100.article_body: Ex-South Africa captain AB de Villiers said Pakistan's batting has "always" been a problem, adding that it is "never" solid enough. "It always goes up and down," stated De Villiers. Pakistan recently suffered a defeat against Zimbabwe in a T20 World Cup 2022 match. Discussing the loss, ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq had said, "Our batters were beaten at least 40 times."

101.title: Putin's hands 'stained in blood': Ukraine seeks Russia's expulsion from G20
101.article_body: Russia should be expelled from the G20 and President Vladimir Putin's invitation to a summit in Bali next month must be revoked, Ukraine's Foreign Ministry Spokesperson said. "Putin publicly acknowledged ordering missile strikes on Ukrainian civilians and energy infrastructure. With his hands stained in blood, he mustn't be allowed to sit at the table with world leaders," Oleg Nikolenko added.

102.title: When PM Modi goes abroad he receives great honour: Gehlot
102.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday said when PM Narendra Modi goes abroad, he receives great honour. "He's PM of the nation of Gandhi, where democracy is deep-rooted. When the world realises this, they feel proud that the PM of that country is coming to them," Gehlot added. Gehlot and PM Modi attended an event in Rajasthan today.

103.title: Woman mowed down by bus in Delhi while trying to cross road
103.article_body: A 27-year-old woman was run over by a bus while she was trying to cross a road in Delhi's Karol Bagh. The entire incident was captured on CCTV. The incident happened when the deceased Sapna, who worked as a receptionist, was heading towards her workplace. "We have seized the bus and are looking for bus owner and driver," police said.

104.title: Rescue operation underway for 3rd day in Morbi bridge collapse site
104.article_body: The rescue operation after the collapse of a suspension bridge in Gujarat's Morbi continued for the third day on Tuesday. At least 135 people died and several others were injured in the incident that took place on Sunday. NDRF said that 12 boats along with a team of 125 people have been deployed at the spot.

105.title: Nykaa shares surge as Q2 net profit rises by 333%, revenue up by 39%
105.article_body: Nykaa parent FSN E-Commerce Ventures reported a 333% surge in September-quarter net profit at ₹5.2 crore as against ₹1.17 crore a year earlier. The company's quarterly revenue from operations recorded a 39% year-on-year increase to ₹1,230.8 crore. At 3:17 pm, the stock was trading 2.88% higher at ₹1,186/piece on NSE. Last week, its stock had tumbled below the ₹1,000 mark.

106.title: Rajinikanth to attend Puneeth Rajkumar's Karnataka Ratna award ceremony
106.article_body: Actor Rajinikanth arrived in Bengaluru to attend an event organised by the Karnataka government to posthumously honour late actor Puneeth Rajkumar with the Karnataka Ratna award. The award is the highest civilian honour conferred by the state. Around 5,000 people are expected to arrive for the event, which will take place on Tuesday evening.

107.title: Sanjay Dutt to star in horror comedy 'The Vir-gin Tree'
107.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt is all set to star in a horror comedy movie, titled 'The Vir-gin Tree'. The movie will be produced by Sanjay's Three Dimension Motion Pictures Pvt Ltd and Deepak Mukut's Soham Rockstar Entertainment. In addition to Sanjay, 'The Vir-gin Tree' will also star Sunny Singh, Mouni Roy and Palak Tiwari among others in pivotal roles.

108.title: No police officer who commits wrongs should be protected: Kerala CM
108.article_body: No police officer who commits wrongs should be protected, Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said on Tuesday adding that such a stand would ensure that everyone worked honestly and without fear. Speaking on the occasion of Kerala Police Formation Day, the CM said there were isolated incidents of police personnel or officers indulging in activities which were wrong.

109.title: 24-year-old woman gang-raped at burial ground in Hyderabad
109.article_body: Two men were arrested in Hyderabad on Monday, hours after they allegedly raped a 24-year-old woman at a burial ground in Ghulam Murtuza Chawni. Ibrahim Baig and Mirza Omer Baig had run away from the scene after committing the crime. Locals took the victim to a police station. The accused were booked under Sections 376D and 376(2)(l) of the IPC.

110.title: US SC rejects Turkey's plea to quash lawsuits over 2017 brawl
110.article_body: The US Supreme Court on Monday dismissed Turkey's plea to quash civil lawsuits in US courts pertaining to a violent brawl outside the Turkish ambassador's residence in Washington on May 16, 2017. The incident took place during a visit by Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan. Erdogan's bodyguards were accused of attacking protesters critical of his government, without any provocation.

111.title: Musk wears ₹6 lakh Halloween costume, people confused about his inspiration
111.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk wore a leather costume for Halloween that is available for $7,500 (over ₹6 lakh) online. The costume was listed as 'Devil's Champion' on a website. After Musk shared his pictures on Twitter, several people couldn't identify whether he was dressed as a known character or who was the inspiration behind his costume.

112.title: Surrogacy has become a big deal as some actors tried it: Varalaxmi
112.article_body: Actress Varalaxmi Sarathkumar said that surrogacy has become a "big deal for buzz as some of the actors have tried it". She also clarified that her upcoming film 'Yashoda' talks about surrogacy but doesn't "mention its good or bad effects". She will be seen playing the head of a surrogacy facility centre in 'Yashoda', which also stars Samantha Ruth Prabhu.

113.title: 23,547 autorickshaws, taxis in Mumbai fined for refusing passengers in Oct
113.article_body: Mumbai Traffic Police (MTP) has fined 23,547 autorickshaws and taxis for refusing short-distance rides in October. Out of these cases, 15,395 autorickshaws were fined ₹50 each, and 8,152 taxis were fined ₹200 each. Earlier this month, MTP issued a notice stating action would be taken against autorickshaws and taxis that refuse to accept customers based on the fare and distance.

114.title: Zimbabwe are a lot better mentally than some of the big teams: Raza
114.article_body: Zimbabwe middle-order batter Sikandar Raza said Zimbabwe are in a "lot better place" mentally in comparison to some of the big teams competing in the T20 World Cup 2022. "We're not going in there to...merely exist...We're going to bring our brand of cricket...and see what happens," added Raza. Zimbabwe will next face Netherlands in the T20 World Cup 2022.

115.title: Gas leak at factory in Ludhiana, 5 persons left unconscious
115.article_body: A carbon dioxide leak at a factory in Ludhiana's Giaspura left five persons unconscious on Tuesday morning, police said. "The leaked gas formed a thick layer in the air and reduced visibility. Five workers in the adjoining unit fainted after inhaling the gas," an official said. The incident occurred when liquid carbon dioxide was being transferred from a tanker.

116.title: Gurugram hospital booked for operating without fire safety clearance
116.article_body: A private hospital named World Laparoscopy Hospital in DLF Phase-2, Gurugram was booked for allegedly functioning without a fire safety clearance and occupancy certificate. An FIR was filed on the directions of a city court after a complaint was made by the Municipal Corporation of Gurugram. However, the hospital said that they are in the process of getting the certificates.

117.title: Suniel bought half of my film's tickets as they were unsold: Jackie
117.article_body: Actor Jackie Shroff, who appeared on KBC 13 with Suniel Shetty, recalled an incident when Suniel had bought half of his film's tickets as they were unsold. "Someone...told us, 'Jackie, all the tickets of your new release haven't been sold yet'...[Suniel] said, 'Buy all the unsold tickets. His movie should have a full audience'," Jackie stated.

118.title: Cong President Mallikarjun Kharge to join Bharat Jodo Yatra in Hyderabad
118.article_body: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge will be joining Bharat Jodo Yatra in Hyderabad this evening, the first time he will do so after becoming the party President. Congress MP Rahul Gandhi and Kharge will hoist the tricolour near the Charminar at the same spot where former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi hoisted the flag in the 1980s.

119.title: I remove my shoes when I go to meet well-wishers, it's a devotion for me: Big B
119.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan, in his latest blog post, said that he removes his shoes when he goes to meet his well-wishers. He said that meeting his well-wishers is a devotion for him. In one of the pictures shared on his blog post, the actor can be seen removing his footwear. He also spoke about the crowd outside his house.

120.title: Some Pak players would sneak out & eat burgers: Afridi on attitude to fitness
120.article_body: Discussing the attitude of some Pakistan players towards fitness, ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi said, "I know a few players who were called by PCB to the High Performance Centre...[for] their diet and training." "However...they [would]...sneak out to eat burgers," added Afridi. "If [players] are not serious about their fitness...PCB can't keep an eye...all the time," he stated.

121.title: US Prez Biden, First Lady host their first Halloween at White House
121.article_body: US President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden on Monday welcomed trick-or-treaters to the White House to celebrate Halloween. It was the Bidens' first time welcoming trick-or-treaters as President and First Lady. Biden wore a navy raincoat and baseball cap, while Jill was dressed in butterfly wings and a purple wig. The treats included chocolate kisses and candy bars.

122.title: Salman is a family guy, respects his parents so much: Sooraj Barjatya
122.article_body: Director Sooraj Barjatya said that Salman Khan might project being someone else, but essentially, he's "a family guy". "He's that elder son who loves his brothers, sisters and respects his parents," Barjatya mentioned, adding that he has never seen someone "more respectful than him". He also confirmed that he has written a version of his family drama with Salman.

123.title: No team can be taken lightly: Dravid ahead of India-Bangladesh T20 WC game
123.article_body: Ahead of India-Bangladesh T20 World Cup Super 12 stage match, India head coach Rahul Dravid said no team can be taken lightly. "At times, it's two hits here and two there. These conditions have made the contest a level-playing field. The grounds are big," he stated. Match will be played on Wednesday. India lost their last match against South Africa.

124.title: 50 nations condemn China's crimes against Uyghurs in Xinjiang
124.article_body: Fifty countries have signed a statement condemning China's crimes against Uyghurs in Xinjiang region. The signatories, including US, Britain, Japan, France, and Somalia among others, called for UN's "urgent attention" against China's treatment of Uyghurs. In August, a UN report said that China was committing serious human rights violations in Xinjiang under anti-extremism policies.

125.title: Chinese billionaire Wu Yajun quits as chairperson from her firm amid real estate crisis
125.article_body: Wu Yajun, the 58-year-old billionaire co-founder of Beijing-based property developer Longfor Properties, has resigned as the chairperson of the company amid the real estate crisis in China. Meanwhile, in an exchange filing, the company said that she stepped down due to health and age reasons. Notably, Yajun topped the Hurun Richest Self-Made Women in the World 2022 list.

126.title: Piyush Goyal condoles demise of Jamshed J Irani, calls him 'changemaker'
126.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Tuesday condoled the demise of Dr Jamshed J Irani, widely known as the 'Steel Man of India', who passed away aged 86 in Jamshedpur late Monday night. Goyal said, "Padma Bhushan...Jamshed J Irani was a changemaker, who helped build trust for Brand India globally." Irani served as the Managing Director of Tata Steel from 1992-2001.

127.title: Salman Khan gets Y+ security cover after threats, X category for Akshay Kumar: Reports
127.article_body: Mumbai Police will provide Y+ security cover to actor Salman Khan. The step has been taken by the state government after he received a threat letter from Lawrence Bishnoi gang earlier, said Maharashtra Police. Actor Akshay Kumar has also been reportedly given X-category security cover. According to reports, Akshay was granted security because of social media threats over his nationality.

128.title: State transport bus Shivshahi catches fire in Pune's Yerawada, video surfaces
128.article_body: State transport bus Shivshahi caught fire in Pune's Yerawada on Tuesday. A video of the incident was shared by Free Press Journal. Reports said that all of the 42 passengers of the bus are safe. The incident took place when the passengers were out of the bus and it was parked on the side of the road.

129.title: India are here to win World Cup, we aren't here to win it: Shakib Al Hasan
129.article_body: Ahead of India-Bangladesh T20 World Cup 2022 clash, Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan said that India are here to win the World Cup, adding that they are the favourites. "We aren't here to win the World Cup. If we beat them then it will be an upset. We will try to create an upset," he added.

130.title: Who is Sriram Krishnan, the engineer helping Elon Musk at Twitter?
130.article_body: Indian American investor, technologist and engineer Sriram Krishnan is temporarily helping out Twitter's new owner Elon Musk with making changes to the micro-blogging site. Krishnan, who did his B.Tech from SRM Engineering College in Tamil Nadu, has previously worked at Facebook, Snap, and Twitter. He's a General Partner at a16z, the firm which invested in Musk's buyout of Twitter.

131.title: Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain good friend of conman Sukesh: BJP
131.article_body: BJP leader Sambit Patra alleged that Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain is a good friend of conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar. Patra also alleged that Jain used to regularly meet Chandrasekhar in Tihar Jail. Jain's secretary told the conman that he needs to pay ₹2 crore every month for basic facilities inside the prison, the BJP leader further alleged.

132.title: Maruti Suzuki sees 21% rise in Oct sales, 1,67,520 units sold last month
132.article_body: India's largest carmaker Maruti Suzuki India on Tuesday reported a 21% increase in its total sales in October 2022, as 1,67,520 units were sold in the last month. It had sold 1,38,335 units in the same month last year. While the company's overall domestic passenger vehicle sales rose 26% in October, its sale of compact vehicles rose to 73,685 units.

133.title: PM Modi declares Rajasthan's Mangarh Dham a national monument
133.article_body: PM Narendra Modi declared Rajasthan's Mangarh Dham a national monument. PM paid tributes to tribals who were massacred by the British army in 1913 in Mangarh. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot, Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel and Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan were present at the event. "Mangarh is a shared heritage of people of Rajasthan, Maharashtra, MP...Gujarat," PM Modi said.

134.title: Anil was told he's ruining his career with 'Mr India': Boney Kapoor
134.article_body: Producer Boney Kapoor revealed that people told Anil Kapoor that 'Mr India' would ruin his career as he would be invisible in major portions of the film. "I had faith...I told Anil that you'll be remembered as Mr India till your last breath," Boney added. The filmmaker further added that he was "broke" after the completion of the film.

135.title: Mother allegedly kills her 10-day-old boy in Karnataka's Mangaluru; booked
135.article_body: A woman has been booked in Karnataka’s Mangaluru for allegedly throwing her 10-day-old baby boy into a well. The accused has been identified as Pavithra, who was suffering from post-natal depression. She wanted to have a baby girl. However, when she had a boy, she was reportedly upset and killed the infant as her wish was not fulfilled.

136.title: Rahul is fantastic, I & Rohit have no doubt over who'll open: Dravid
136.article_body: Rahul Dravid said India opener KL Rahul is a "fantastic" player, adding that he's confident about Rahul making a strong comeback. Dravid stated that he and Rohit Sharma have "no doubt" over the other opener barring Rohit. "I know how much impact Rahul can make," he said. Rahul has scored 22 runs in the T20 World Cup 2022 so far.

137.title: Rohith Vemula's mother joins Bharat Jodo Yatra, meets Rahul Gandhi
137.article_body: On day 55 of the Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra, party MP Rahul Gandhi met the mother of Rohith Vemula, a Dalit student of the University of Hyderabad who died by suicide in 2016 after an episode of alleged harassment. She showed her support by walking briefly with Rahul Gandhi during the morning leg of the yatra in Telangana’s Shamshabad.

138.title: Impossible for any auto firm to be profitable in 1st yr: MG Motor India
138.article_body: Responding to the Corporate Affairs Ministry's notice to MG Motor India regarding its operational losses in 2019-2020, the automaker said, "It is impossible for any automobile company to be profitable in the very first year of its operations." Ministry had reportedly started the probe after an analysis of the automaker's statements that indicated suspicious transactions and other irregularities.

139.title: I know if I eat a paratha, coach will make me pay for it in training the next day: Neeraj
139.article_body: India's Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra, in a recent interview, said that he lost control after winning the gold medal at Olympics and gained weight. "Now I am controlling but in training...I know if I eat a paratha or something the coach will make me pay for it during training the next day," the 24-year-old said.

140.title: Son of ex-Punjab Police head constable arrested for murder in Chandigarh
140.article_body: Chandigarh Police arrested a 24-year-old man for allegedly killing a woman, whose body was recovered on October 28 behind the Sukhna Lake. The arrested man, Jagroop Singh, is the son of a late Punjab Police head constable, who passed away on duty last year, according to the police. Jagroop was purportedly in a relationship with the woman.

141.title: Twitter engineers asked to look at Vine's code for its revival: Report
141.article_body: Elon Musk's team has asked Twitter engineers to look into short video app Vine's code to see how much work it would take to revive it, media reports said citing sources. Musk started a Twitter poll on Sunday on whether he should bring back Vine. He has instructed engineers to work on a reboot that could be ready by year-end.

142.title: Unacceptable for ships to cross Black Sea after grain deal suspension: Russia
142.article_body: Russia has said it is "unacceptable" for ships to pass through Black Sea security corridor after it suspended participation in grain deal. The Russian Defence Ministry accused Ukraine of using security corridor to conduct military operations against Russia. It said there can be no question of guaranteeing security until Ukraine accepts obligation to not use Black Sea for military purposes.

143.title: Italian mafia kingpin wanted since 2015 captured in Argentina
143.article_body: Argentina's police have arrested a top Italian mobster wanted since 2015. Carmine Alfonso Maiorano, leader of the Italian 'Ndrangheta mafia, is accused by international authorities of carrying out drug trafficking and arms trafficking operations in Latin America and Europe. Interpol considers 'Ndrangheta as "one of the most extensive and powerful criminal organizations in the world".

144.title: Saudi Aramco's Q3 net income rises by 39% on higher crude prices
144.article_body: Saudi Arabian state oil producer, Saudi Aramco, reported a 39% rise in its third-quarter net income to $42.4 billion, led by higher crude oil prices and sales volume. Its free cash flow rose to $45 billion year-on-year from $28.7 billion. It also declared a dividend of $18.8 billion in the third quarter, which will be paid in the fourth quarter.

145.title: Singer AP Dhillon suffers injury during tour in US, shares pic from hospital
145.article_body: Singer AP Dhillon has been hospitalised after suffering an injury while on a tour in the US. Sharing a picture of his bandaged arm on Instagram, Dhillon announced that his shows in Los Angeles and San Francisco are being postponed. "I'm doing well and...expected to fully recover. However, I will not be able to perform at this time," he wrote.

146.title: Foxconn hikes daily bonuses by 4 times for staff amid COVID-19 curbs in China
146.article_body: After videos showed workers escaping from iPhone maker Foxconn’s Zhengzhou plant in China amid COVID-19 restrictions, Foxconn has quadrupled bonuses to retain staff at the manufacturing site. According to the WeChat account of Foxconn's Zhengzhou plant, daily bonuses for employees have been raised to 400 yuan for November from 100 yuan. Foxconn produces 70% of iPhone shipments globally.

147.title: I lost control after Olympics and gained weight: Neeraj Chopra
147.article_body: India's Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra, in a recent interview, said that he lost control after winning the gold medal at Olympics and gained weight. "Now I am controlling but in training...I know if I eat a paratha or something the coach will make me pay for it during training the next day," the 24-year-old said.

148.title: Europeans ask me if Indians have to return the money parents spend on raising them: Neeraj
148.article_body: India's Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra, in an interview, said people in Europe ask him if Indians have to return the money parents spend on raising them after they start earning. "I tell them it’s different here. I think it’s only in our culture that even after growing up we live with our parents as kids," Neeraj said.

149.title: SaaS startup Icertis raises $150 million from Silicon Valley Bank
149.article_body: Software-as-a-service (SaaS) startup Icertis has secured $150 million through revolving credit facility and convertible debt from US-based Silicon Valley Bank. After the latest funding round, the company's total capital has reached $520 million. The company was co-founded by former Aztecsoft CEO Samir Bodas and former BladeLogic executive Monish Darda in 2009.

150.title: Couple, maid found dead under mysterious circumstances in Delhi
150.article_body: A couple and their maid were found dead at their residence in Delhi's Hari Nagar area under mysterious circumstances, police said on Tuesday. The CCTV footage of the area is being analysed to identify the culprits and a murder case has been filed, according to the police. Officials said that the couple's two-year-old daughter was found safe, according to reports.

151.title: 2 men stab dog to death after it constantly barks at them for days in MP
151.article_body: Two men aged between 20 and 25 years stabbed a stray dog to death using a knife in Madhya Pradesh. The two said that the dog had been constantly barking at them for days. An official said that the two accused got angry after the dog barked at them again on Sunday night. The dog died on the spot.

152.title: Didn't sleep, helped people entire night: Eyewitness of Morbi bridge collapse
152.article_body: An eyewitness to Gujarat's Morbi bridge collapse incident said that he saw people hanging from cables and then slipping down. The eyewitness, who sells tea near the bridge every Sunday, said, "I didn't sleep and helped people the entire night. It was heart-wrenching to see a 7-8-month-pregnant woman die. Never saw anything like that in my life," he added.

153.title: Police destroy 400 kg of drugs seized in 133 cases in Ambala
153.article_body: Police have destroyed 400 kg of drugs which had been seized in 133 cases at a waste management unit in Haryana's Ambala on Monday. The drugs included 2.98 kg of chura post, 91.8 kg of ganja, 900 gm of heroin, 1.5 kg of sulfa, 10 gm of charas and several intoxicant capsules, tablets, injections and syrups, a police spokesperson said.

154.title: Was forced to pay ₹10 cr to AAP's Satyendar Jain as 'protection money': Conman Sukesh
154.article_body: In a letter to Delhi L-G VK Saxena, jailed conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar has alleged that he was forced to pay ₹10 crore to Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Satyendar Jain as "protection money". Sukesh said that a total amount of ₹50 crore was paid to the AAP as he was promised an important party position in south India.

155.title: Video of monkey drinking beer near UP liquor shop goes viral; shopkeepers file complaint
155.article_body: A video showing monkey drinking beer near a liquor shop in Uttar Pradesh's Raebareli is going viral on social media. The liquor shopkeepers in the region complained against the monkey accusing it of stealing alcohol from their shops and also snatching bottles from their customers. District Excise Officer Rajendra Pratap Singh said efforts are being made to catch the monkey.

156.title: GST collections rise to ₹1.52 lakh crore in October, 2nd highest ever
156.article_body: India collected ₹1.52 lakh crore in Goods and Services Tax (GST) in October, marking the second-highest monthly collection ever after that in April 2022, the Finance Ministry said. The monthly GST revenues have been over ₹1.40 lakh crore for eight straight months. In October, central GST was ₹26,039 crore, state GST was ₹33,396 crore and integrated GST was ₹81,778 crore.

157.title: Toyota Motor's Q2 profit falls by 25%, FY output target cut to 9.2 mn
157.article_body: Toyota Motor reported a 25% fall in second-quarter operating profit to 562.7 billion yen ($3.79 billion) as against a 749.9-billion yen profit in the corresponding period last year. Toyota said last week that its global production rebounded by 30% in the September quarter. However, it cut its fiscal output target to 9.2 million vehicles on continuing risks to chip supply.

158.title: 4 sickened by carbon dioxide release at Los Angeles airport
158.article_body: Four people, a woman and three men, were sickened by a release of carbon dioxide in a Los Angeles International Airport utility room on Monday. All people hurt in the incident were airport employees and one man is in grave condition, officials said. "The carbon dioxide displaced the oxygen in his bloodstream and he went into cardiac arrest," they said.

159.title: India reports 1,046 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 17,618
159.article_body: India reported 1,046 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 1,326 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 17,618. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,29,077 following 53 casualties in the last 24 hours.

160.title: Afghanistan crash out of T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals race after losing to Sri Lanka
160.article_body: Sri Lanka defeated Afghanistan by six wickets in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage Group 1 match on Tuesday. Afghanistan put up a total of 144/8 in their 20 overs, with Sri Lanka chasing down the target in 18.3 overs. With this, Afghanistan have crashed out of the T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals race.

161.title: Google pauses Play Store billing in India after ₹936-crore fine by CCI
161.article_body: Google has paused its plans to enforce the Play billing system on Indian developers from October 31 following the ruling by the Competition Commission of India. CCI imposed two fines on Google, one worth ₹936.44 crore for abusing its dominant position in reference to Play Store policies and the second for ₹1,338 crore for abusing dominance in Android device market.

162.title: Stuff of dreams: Satwik after winning historic Super 750 title with Chirag
162.article_body: Reacting to becoming the first Indian doubles pair to win a Super 750 title alongside Chirag Shetty, Satwiksairaj Rankireddy took to Instagram to share, "I am thrilled beyond words and humbled beyond comparison!" "[It] is definitely the stuff of dreams! But not a moment longer to rest on our laurels, bigger goals [and] bigger titles are ahead," added Satwiksairaj.

163.title: HC bar association goes on strike over NIA seizing lawyer's phone
163.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court Bar Association decided to go on an indefinite strike on Monday over the National Investigation Agency (NIA) not returning the phone of a lawyer which it had seized during a raid in October. The lawyer, whose house was raided, has been representing some gangsters. The bar association had suspended work over the issue in October.

164.title: Bappi Lahiri's 'Jimmy Jimmy' being used by Chinese citizens to protest COVID lockdowns
164.article_body: Bappi Lahiri's song 'Jimmy Jimmy' is being used by Chinese citizens to protest COVID-19 lockdowns in the country. In videos that went viral, the song is sung in Mandarin as "Jie mi, jie mi", which translates to "Give me rice, give me rice". People posted the video to show how they have been deprived of essential food items during lockdowns.

165.title: Maha aarti to resume at Mumbai's Banganga after 2 years
165.article_body: The Maha aarti at Banganga in Mumbai will be started again after a gap of two years. The aarti will be held on November 7 at 7 pm. Over 1,000 diyas will be lit during the aarti which is done on the occasion of Kartik Purnima, reports said. Many dignitaries including Chief Minister Eknath Shinde are invited to the event.

166.title: India adopted zero-tolerance approach to terrorism, says President Murmu
166.article_body: While addressing Heads of Delegations of the UN Security Council’s Counter-Terrorism Committee, President Droupadi Murmu emphasised that India has adopted a zero-tolerance approach to terrorism. She said, "India has been a victim of terrorism for decades…I’m confident that the discussions during the meeting will provide good foundations for concrete action by the international community."

167.title: It's one place where you hope to feel safe: Dravid on leaked video of Kohli's hotel room
167.article_body: Reacting to video of Virat Kohli's hotel room getting leaked online, Rahul Dravid said, "[Hotel room] is one place where you feel you are away from people's prying eyes and without the media glare on you." He added, "It is one place where you hope to feel secure and safe, and that's taken away...it's not really a nice feeling."

168.title: Has he also played for India? Shahid Afridi on Amit Mishra's tweet for Babar
168.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi reacted to veteran cricketer Amit Mishra's "This too shall pass, stay strong" tweet for Pakistan captain Babar Azam amid his poor form. "Has Amit Mishra also played for India? Was he a spinner or batter?" Afridi said on TV. Notably, Babar had posted a similar tweet for Virat Kohli when the latter was battling poor form.

169.title: WB man rapes girl to get her blood for removing marriage obstacles
169.article_body: A 37-year-old man allegedly raped an eight-year-old girl in West Bengal's Bankura to get blood from her private parts believing that it'd help remove the obstacles to his marriage, police said on Monday. A tantrik told the man that his problems would be solved if he brought a cloth soaked in blood from a minor girl's private parts, police added.

170.title: No water, power supply in much of Kyiv amid Russian attacks
170.article_body: Russian cruise missile and drone strikes hit infrastructure in Ukrainian cities including Kyiv and Kharkiv on Monday, knocking out water and power supplies. Russian President Vladimir Putin said bombardment was in retaliation for an unsuccessful Ukrainian aerial and underwater drone attack on Russia's Black Sea Fleet. A Ukrainian official said the Kremlin was taking revenge for military failures.

171.title: 'Kantara' director Rishab Shetty says he won't do Hindi films
171.article_body: 'Kantara' director-actor Rishab Shetty was recently asked if he is willing to make his Bollywood debut. In response, Shetty said, "I don't do Hindi movies. I dub my Kannada movies into Hindi. I have no plans to enter Hindi cinema." Earlier, talking about his Kannada film 'Kantara', Rishab stated that the film shouldn't be remade in Hindi.

172.title: Musk changed Twitter's homepage in less than 24 hours after taking control: Report
172.article_body: Elon Musk decided to change Twitter's homepage in less than 24 hours after taking control of the company on Friday, The Verge reported. Logged out users visiting Twitter.com are now redirected to the Explore page that shows trending tweets and news stories. Earlier, people who visited Twitter's homepage while logged out of their accounts were only showed a sign-up form.

173.title: Hospital where Morbi bridge victims are admitted painted overnight for PM's visit
173.article_body: The civil hospital in Gujarat's Morbi, where victims of the suspension bridge collapse are admitted, was painted overnight for Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit on Tuesday. Over 130 people lost their lives in the bridge collapse. Reports said that new water coolers were brought in and bedsheets were changed in the two wards where the victims have been admitted.

174.title: Thane suicide victim accused 2 for cheating him of ₹17 lakh in video: Police
174.article_body: The family of a 40-year-old man who died by suicide on October 10 in Thane's Mumbra said that he had made a video before dying and said two people owed him ₹17 lakh for supplies they purchased from him. "The video mentions names of two persons," police said. He was under stress and told his family that he was cheated.

175.title: 38-yr-old Hyd engineer drowns in well while playing 'treasure hunt'
175.article_body: A 38-year-old engineer from Hyderabad, Sai Kumar, drowned in a 30-foot-deep well while playing a 'treasure hunt'. Kumar went to Hyderabad Adventure Club’s Moonlight Camping in Godhumaguda village along with his friends and colleagues on Saturday, police said.
