350.title: 3% of Mumbai's women have hypertension, 2% have diabetes: BMC
350.article_body: A health campaign carried out by the BMC found that 3% of Mumbai's 18-plus woman population has hypertension while 2% has diabetes. In Mumbai, 2,13,177 women were screened for hypertension, while 2,05,345 were screened for diabetes. The 'Mata Surakshit Toh Ghar Surakshit' drive was to end on October 31 but has been extended to mid-November.

351.title: Snake found under bed at Telangana's MGM Hospital; video surfaces
351.article_body: A snake was found under a patient's bed in a ward of Mahatma Gandhi Memorial (MGM) Hospital in Telangana's Warangal. A video of the incident showed the snake slithering under the bed in the second such incident reported from the hospital in less than two weeks. A patient's attendant had, on October 13, found a cobra inside MGM Hospital's washroom.

352.title: Aliens do walk among us: Wasim Akram on Virat Kohli after India's win over Pakistan
352.article_body: After Virat Kohli helped India defeat Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday, former Pakistan captain Wasim Akram said, "Aliens do walk among us, he's one of the best I've seen in the recent or modern greats." Akram added, "He has been scoring for the last 15 years, and he has the best average while chasing."

353.title: Kohli praises Ashwin for leaving ball in last over, says 'Dimag ke upar extra dimag lagaya'
353.article_body: Virat Kohli praised Ravichandran Ashwin for leaving a delivery bowled by Pakistan's Muhammad Nawaz in last over, which went on to be a wide. He said, "I told Ashwin to hit...ball over covers. But Ash...usne dimaag ke upar extra dimag lagaya. That was a brave thing for him to do...Ball came inside the line and he turned it into wide."

354.title: Inspection done at Pune Railway Station, additional staff deployed
354.article_body: After a Bihar labourer lost his life due to heavy crowds at the Pune Railway station, a detailed inspection was carried by the Pune Railway Division and the Railway Protection Force (RPF) police.  The Pune Railway Division also deployed additional manpower of RPF policemen and other railway staff at all platforms. They reviewed security arrangements and the crowd was monitored.

355.title: We are prepared to tackle incidents on Diwali: Delhi Fire Service
355.article_body: Even though it is illegal to burst firecrackers in the national capital, the Delhi Fire Service (DFS) has made all the arrangements to handle fire occurrences on Diwali. "We are prepared with drones and to access high-rise buildings. Fire tenders have been deployed near congested areas. However, we expect there will not be many fire-related incidents," chief of DFS said.

356.title: Coimbatore cylinder blast definite act of terror by fidayeen: Report
356.article_body: The cylinder blast in Coimbatore is a definite act of terror by fidayeen, reports said. Jamesha Mubin, who was killed in the cylinder blast on Sunday, had written "if the news about my death reaches you, forgive my mistakes, hide my shortcomings, participate in 'Janaasa' and pray for me" on the display of his mobile phone, reports added.

357.title: Hasan Minhaj points out his resemblance to Suryakumar in graphic shared by ICC
357.article_body: Comedian Hasan Minhaj took to Twitter to point out his resemblance to Suryakumar Yadav in a  graphic of the Indian cricketer shared by the ICC. Reacting to the cricketer's graphic, the comedian tweeted, "Pls tag me next time ICC." Several Twitter users agreed that the two resembled each other, with a user tweeting, "Separated at birth?"

358.title: Protestors throw chocolate cake on King Charles III's wax statue in UK
358.article_body: Two supporters of 'Just Stop Oil' attacked a Madame Tussauds waxwork model of King Charles III with chocolate cake in London. The protestors demanded that the UK government halts all new oil and gas licences and consent. "The science is clear. The demand is simple: just stop new oil and gas. It's a piece of cake," the protestors said.

359.title: Fitbit sued in Australia over refund policy on faulty devices
359.article_body: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) began court proceedings against Fitbit for misleading consumers about faulty devices. Fitbit has come under fire for claiming that consumers won't get refunded unless they return faulty products within 45 days of purchase, which is against Australian Consumer Law. The ACCC said that 58 consumers were allegedly misled by Fitbit.

360.title: We've been lot more nicer in this season: Bani on 'Four...' co-stars
360.article_body: Speaking about the bond between 'Four More Shots Please!' co-stars, actress Bani J has said they have been a lot "nicer" in the third season. "(We have been) a lot more of understanding," she added. "Somebody said tolerance the other day, but it's not tolerance. It's more of an understanding like...'let her be'. That kind of an understanding," Bani stated.

361.title: BJP leader Rapolu Bhaskar quits party, set to join ruling TRS
361.article_body: Ahead of the Munugode bypolls, BJP leader Rapolu Ananda Bhaskar resigned from the party and is set to join the ruling TRS on Monday. He expressed disappointment over the Centre’s decision to levy GST on handlooms and said that he appreciated CM KCR’s measures to enhance the condition of weavers in the state.

362.title: PWD proposes ₹12 crore budget to govt for Mumbai’s JJ Hospital renovation
362.article_body: The Maharashtra State Human Rights Commission (MSHRC) has directed the PWD to start repairs in Mumbai's JJ Hospital immediately. The PWD, according to a junior officer, has submitted a report to the government with a proposed budget of ₹12.66 crore. MSHRC said they have been receiving complaints about the hospital's infrastructure from resident doctors for a "long time".

363.title: People started taking me seriously after 'Four More...': Maanvi Gagroo
363.article_body: Actress Maanvi Gagroo has said that people started taking her seriously after her series 'Four More Shots Please!'. "Till 'Four More Shots Please!' happened I was getting roles that were girl-next-door," she stated. Maanvi added that the show also helped with her social media following. "The kind of offers I'm getting now are interesting...Thankfully...I can pick and choose," she said.

364.title: Kerala HC’s special hearing on VCs’ petition against Governor order
364.article_body: The Vice-Chancellors of nine universities of Kerala, who were asked to resign by the Governor's Office, have approached the Kerala High Court. The High Court will hold a special sitting at 4 pm on Monday to consider the petition. "I have received the decision...but I will not submit my resignation...This is a fake accusation," said Kannur University VC Gopinath Ravindar.

365.title: Ugandan capital's Ebola tally reaches 14 with 9 new confirmed cases
365.article_body: Nine more people tested positive for Ebola in Uganda's capital Kampala on Sunday, the Ugandan Health Ministry said on Monday, taking the city's number of confirmed cases reported since Saturday to 14. All the patients who have tested positive were in isolation when they became symptomatic, the ministry said. The current Ebola outbreak in Uganda began in September.

366.title: French court approves €238 million Credit Suisse settlement
366.article_body: A French court approved a €238 million (₹19.37 lakh crore) settlement between Credit Suisse Group and the French financial prosecution office to settle a tax fraud and money laundering case. Under the terms of the agreement, the Swiss bank makes no admission of guilt. The settlement will see the bank pay a fine of €123 million to the state.

367.title: B'luru couple finds burglar dead in their pooja room after returning from Europe trip
367.article_body: A couple from Bengaluru who returned from a Europe trip found the dead body of a man in the puja room of their house. A CCTV camera footage shows that the burglar ate from the kitchen, took a shower and slept in the bedroom before dying by suicide. Police said he had been arrested in various house theft cases.

368.title: Opp'n claims Tripura minister’s son involved in 16-yr-old’s gangrape
368.article_body: Three people, including a woman, have been arrested for their alleged involvement in the gangrape of a 16-year-old girl in Tripura's Unakoti district. The opposition Congress and CPI(M) have claimed that a state minister's son was involved in the incident and called for his arrest. The girl was allegedly gang-raped in a three-storey building in Kumarghat on October 19.

369.title: B'luru couple finds burglar dead in their pooja room after returning from Europe trip
369.article_body: A couple from Bengaluru who returned from a Europe trip found the dead body of a man in the puja room of their house. A CCTV camera footage shows that the burglar ate from the kitchen, took a shower and slept in the bedroom before dying by suicide. Police said he had been arrested in various house theft cases.

370.title: Starlink won't be turned off even without funding: Musk to Ukrainian Vice PM
370.article_body: Billionaire Elon Musk on Monday reassured Ukrainian Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov that his firm SpaceX "would not turn off Starlink even if [US Department of Defence] refused to provide funding". Musk was replying to media reports claiming some European Union countries may fund Starlink services in Ukraine. "Thanks Musk...This was critically important for Ukraine. We're grateful to you!" Fedorov said.

371.title: 4 pose as policemen & rob Mumbai beautician of cash, valuables worth ₹7 lakh
371.article_body: Mumbai Police on Saturday arrested three people, including a woman, who allegedly posed as police officers and barged into a beautician's house, robbing her of cash and valuables worth over ₹7 lakh. The police, during the interrogation, learned that the victim's family friend had informed the accused about the valuables, following which a plan was hatched, a police officer said.

372.title: US, UK warn of possible terror attack in Nigeria's capital Abuja
372.article_body: The US and Britain on Sunday warned their citizens in Nigeria about a possible terror attack in the country's capital, Abuja, aimed at government buildings and tourist attractions, among other targets. Nigeria has been battling an Islamist insurgency since 2009, primarily in the northeast. In July, however, the Islamic State claimed responsibility for a major prison raid in Abuja.

373.title: Mumbai gang clones debit cards, withdraws ₹6.47 lakh in 58 transactions
373.article_body: A gang in Mumbai withdrew ₹6.47 lakh through 58 transactions in three days. Using cloned debit cards, the gang withdrew ₹500 on October 4, ₹4.9 lakh in 49 transactions on October 5 and ₹70,000 in seven transactions on October 6 from an ATM in Marol. They also withdrew ₹87,000 in two transactions from an ATM in Chakala on October 5-6.

374.title: India break world record for winning most matches in int'l cricket in a calendar year
374.article_body: The last-ball four-wicket victory against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022 on Sunday was India's 39th victory in international cricket in 2022. With this, India broke the world record for winning the most number of matches in international cricket in a calendar year. The previous record was held by Australia, who had won 38 matches in 2003.

375.title: Fans will watch film that appeals to them: Akshay on Ram Setu-Thank God clash
375.article_body: Akshay Kumar, speaking about the clash between his film 'Ram Setu' and Ajay Devgn-starrer 'Thank God', has said that there is no clash. "Fans will choose to watch the one that appeals to them the most or better...watch both," he stated. Akshay added, "The main objective is for...fans to enjoy the festival at the movies with friends and family."

376.title: Delhi man dies after his parked SUV catches fire in Alipur
376.article_body: A man was burnt alive after his parked SUV caught fire in Delhi's Alipur area on Sunday. The victim has not yet been identified as only his bones remained after the fire. "The car is registered in the name of a person who lives in Kurukshetra [in Haryana]. A police team has been sent...for further inquiry," police said.

377.title: 'Kantara' beats 'KGF: Chapter 1', becomes 2nd highest-grossing Kannada film
377.article_body: Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara' has earned around ₹188 crore worldwide since its release, making it the second highest-grossing Kannada film. The film went past Yash's 'KGF: Chapter 1'. However, 'KGF: Chapter 2' is still the highest-grossing Kannada film. In India, Kantara has earned ₹170.50 crore, with the film earning ₹111.25 crore in Karnataka.

378.title: Celebrate Diwali with deprived people, UP CM tells officers & employees
378.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath extended Diwali greetings on Monday and urged officers and employees to celebrate the festival with the deprived and needy people. In a tweet, CM Adityanath said that it should be our endeavour to illuminate every house with the spirit of harmony, adding that there should be 'Ramatv' all around.

379.title: North Korea and South Korea exchange warning shots near sea border
379.article_body: North and South Korea exchanged warning shots off the western coast of the Korean Peninsula on Monday. Seoul said its forces fired warning shots to repel a North Korean merchant vessel that had breached the Northern Limit Line (NLL), the de facto sea boundary between the two countries. Meanwhile, Pyongyang accused a South Korean naval ship of violating the NLL.

380.title: OTTs, social media platforms may pay access charge to telcos: Report
380.article_body: Social media platforms like WhatsApp, Facebook and Twitter, along with over-the-top (OTT) firms like Netflix, Prime Video and Disney+Hotstar, may reportedly have to pay carriage charge to telecom operators. As data grows, telecom service providers have to keep increasing their carriage capacity and backhaul networks, which requires investment. The draft Telecom Bill may adopt this regulation.

381.title: That's why they won the match: Babar on journalist's 'Kohli was the difference' remark
381.article_body: During the press conference following Pakistan's defeat against India in T20 World Cup 2022, a journalist, while asking a question, remarked Virat Kohli was the difference between the two sides. Pakistan captain Babar Azam interrupted the journalist and said, "That's why they won the match." He further said that Kohli's 53-ball 82* knock will give the India batter "more confidence".

382.title: WWE's Heyman shares Kohli's pic, jokes 'He acknowledged our tribal chief Reigns'
382.article_body: WWE wrestler Roman Reigns' special counsel Paul Heyman shared a picture of Virat Kohli from celebrations following India's win against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022. He jokingly wrote, "It's with great honor that I, #SpecialCounsel and #Wiseman to #Bloodline, accept the great @imVkohli's celebration as, in front of the world, he decided to acknowledge our tribal chief @WWERomanReigns."

383.title: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw's husband John Shaw passes away
383.article_body: Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw's husband John Shaw passed away on Monday. He was the former Vice Chairman of Biocon. John, a member of Biocon's board of directors since 1999, was a foreign promoter and on the advisory board of various Biocon group companies, according to the company's website.

384.title: Delhi was most polluted city in the world, not anymore: Kejriwal
384.article_body: After Delhi was not featured on the list of the top 10 most polluted cities of Asia, CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "Some years back, [Delhi] was the most polluted city in the world. Not anymore!" Lauding the people of the city, he added "While we have improved, there is still a long way to go".

385.title: India will always seek to strengthen UN's effectiveness: S Jaishankar
385.article_body: On the 77th anniversary of the United Nations, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar claimed that India will always seek to strengthen the UN's effectiveness. "India’s ongoing tenure as a member of the Security Council has reflected our principled approach of promoting dialogue and diplomacy to meet contemporary challenges. We will always stand with the Global South," tweeted Jaishankar.

386.title: After 'Tanhaji', I was offered to play Shivaji Maharaj many times: Sharad
386.article_body: Actor Sharad Kelkar revealed he was offered the role of Shivaji Maharaj many times after his portrayal of the character in Ajay Devgn-starrer 'Tanhaji'.  "I responded by asking 'How many films will I do with the same character?' And they said that they feel I would do justice to the character," he added. Sharad will feature in 'Har Har Mahadev'.

387.title: Multiple subways in B'luru continue to remain submerged despite no rains
387.article_body: Multiple subways in Bengaluru continued to remain filled with water despite the city witnessing no rains in the past few days. Commuters complained that many pedestrian subways, including the Nrupathunga Road and Raj Bhavan Road subways, were inaccessible due to the water. "It has been over three days. There is no action from the authorities," a resident said.

388.title: China's GDP grows by 3.9% Y-o-Y in July-September quarter
388.article_body: The GDP of China showed a 3.9% year-on-year growth in the July-September quarter, amid a raft of government measure. However, domestic demand declined towards the end of the quarter due to persistent COVID-19 restrictions, a prolonged property slump and global recession risks. In the nine months to September, China's inflation-adjusted urban per capita consumption fell 0.2% on year.

389.title: World's largest diya lit up in Punjab's Mohali; pic surfaces
389.article_body: The world's largest diya was lit up in Punjab's Mohali amid Diwali festivities. More than 10,000 people contributed 3,560 litres of oil for an event to light up the diya made with 1,000 kilograms of steel. The diya, which was recognised as the world's largest by the Guinness World Records, measures 3.37 metres in diameter.

390.title: 258 people arrested in Chhattisgarh for luring people into online betting
390.article_body: Chhattisgarh Police has arrested 258 people in 25 cases over the past month for operating centres to lure people into online betting via online application 'Mahadev'. The application was launched by group of people operating out of Dubai. "They opened around 30 centres, mostly in Chhattisgarh, and over ₹200 crores of transactions happen from each of these centres," police said.

391.title: Mumbai Police turn 'bhajiwala', 'doodhwala' to crack 30-yr-old assault case
391.article_body: Mumbai Police cracked a 30-year-old assault case and arrested a 57-year-old man for allegedly assaulting a woman in 1993. Police posed as milkmen, vegetable vendors, courier boys and postmen to nab the accused, who was taken into custody on October 20. The accused had attacked the victim with a chopper and was on the Mumbai Police's most wanted list.

392.title: 2 bodies found after plane carrying Gold's Gym owner crashed off Costa Rica
392.article_body: Two dead bodies were recovered by Costa Rican authorities on Sunday during their search for people who were on board a small plane that crashed in the Caribbean Sea on Friday. Rainer Schaller, the owner of fitness chains Gold's Gym and McFit, and five others were listed as being on the aircraft. The recovered bodies could not be identified immediately.

393.title: Jindal Group to enter lending business with ₹400 crore investment
393.article_body: Gaurav Sachdeva, the Chief Executive Officer of JSW One Platforms (JSWOP), said the JSW group will enter the lending space with an investment of up to ₹400 crore in a non-bank finance company (NBFC). The NBFC will be a subsidiary of JSWOP. Sachdeva said the NBFC can help other JSW companies like cement, steel, or paints by offering financing solutions.

394.title: Russian oil supplies to China in Sept rise 22% YoY, second to Saudi
394.article_body: Russian oil supplies to China in September 2022 rose 22% YoY while Saudi Arabia remained the top oil supplier to China. Russian supplies in September totalled 7.46 million tonnes, equivalent to 1.82 million barrels per day (bpd), data from Chinese General Administration of Customs showed. This is down from the record high of nearly 2 million bpd imported in May.

395.title: Notice asks women lawyers to not 'arrange hair in open court' in Pune; pic shared
395.article_body: Senior Supreme Court advocate Indira Jaising has shared a picture of a Pune court notice that asked women advocates to refrain from arranging their hair. "It's repeatedly noticed that women advocates are arranging their hair in open Court, which is disturbing the functioning of the Court," it read. "Wow now look! Who's distracted by women advocates and why," Jaising wrote.

396.title: Major fire breaks out at drugs manufacturing unit in Chennai
396.article_body: A major fire broke out at a private drugs manufacturing unit in Tamil Nadu's Chennai on Monday. The fire department received the information about the fire at around 8.15 am and several fire tenders were rushed to the spot. The fire engulfed the entire building and several vehicles parked near the firm were also charred.

397.title: Taskin records his career-best T20I figures as B'desh defeat Netherlands
397.article_body: Bangladesh defeated Netherlands by nine runs in their T20 World Cup Super 12 stage match on Monday. Batting first, Bangladesh posted a total of 144/8, with Afif Hossain (38 off 27) being the top-scorer for the side. Netherlands were eventually bowled out for 135 runs as Bangladesh pacer Taskin Ahmed registered his career-best T20I figures of 4-0-25-4 in the match.

398.title: People asked me, 'Hero kaun hai?' I replied 'me': Janhvi Kapoor on 'Mili'
398.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said whenever she tells people she's working on a female-oriented film, they address it "like it's an anomaly". She asked if they'd ask an actor their feeling about doing a male-oriented film if her upcoming film 'Mili' was called 'Milan'. "Many times, when I'm doing this film, I'm asked, 'Hero kaun hai?'...I answer 'Me'," she stated.

399.title: Power connection of Bhagat Singh's house never disconnected: Administration
399.article_body: The district administration of Shaheed Bhagat Singh Nagar, Punjab, rejected reports that the power connection of freedom fighter Bhagat Singh's ancestral house was disconnected. "In fact, Powercom has an advance bill payment worth ₹6,760 with them," Deputy Commissioner Navjot Singh said. He also made an appeal to the media not to use the name of Bhagat Singh's ancestral house.

400.title: At least 220 killed in tribal clashes in southern Sudan
400.article_body: At least 220 people were killed in two days of tribal fighting as of Saturday night in Sudan's southern Blue Nile province, a senior health official said on Sunday. The clashes erupted in the town of Wad el-Mahi due to a land dispute between two tribes. A 30-day state of emergency has been declared in the Blue Nile province.

401.title: Why was Karthik given out despite Rizwan collecting ball in front of wickets?
401.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik was stumped out by Pakistan wicketkeeper Muhammad Rizwan on the bowling of Muhammad Nawaz in the last over despite Rizwan collecting the ball in front of wickets. The ball wasn't called a no-ball as the ball had hit Karthik's pads before reaching Rizwan. As per MCC's Law 27.3.1, Rizwan's collection of the ball was legitimate.
